meanings.definition: superlative form of dangly, meaning hanging or swinging loosely
meanings.sent1: The chandelier with the dangliest crystals sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Her hair was the dangliest at the ends, flowing freely in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tail was the dangliest thing as it tried to catch its own shadow.
meanings.sent4: The old bridge swayed in the wind, its cables looking dangliest of all.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web was the dangliest, shimmering with dewdrops in the morning light.

meanings.definition: in a manner that hangs or swings loosely
meanings.sent1: The curtains moved dangliest when the window was open.
meanings.sent2: She walked dangliest down the hallway, her dress flowing behind her.
meanings.sent3: The pirate ship rocked dangliest on the rough sea, making the crew dizzy.
meanings.sent4: The swing moved dangliest when the children played together at the park.
meanings.sent5: The branches swayed dangliest in the gentle breeze, creating a peaceful scene.

meanings.definition: the part of something that hangs or swings loosely
meanings.sent1: The dangliest of the mobile were the tiny stars that spun above the crib.
meanings.sent2: He held onto the dangliest part of the rope ladder as he climbed up.
meanings.sent3: The cat toy had feathers on the dangliest end, enticing the playful feline.
meanings.sent4: The wind chime's dangliest piece made the most soothing sound in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The pendant on her necklace was the dangliest, catching the light with every movement.
